body: Q. Suppose the shorts just keep paying interest. Suppose they pay the whole dividend on April 4. And suppose they pay more interest from April 5 to April 30.
What happens to the stock price during all of that time? Do they continue to press downward on the price?
Or does the expense become so high that no shorter in his or her right mind would do this?
